property.name: Flavour
property.value: Welcome to the killing floor. Grooves in this chamber's floor are designed to sluice away the blood of the fallen. Gristle clings to its cold metal walls. Heroes are herded into this chamber, while other sacrificial victims are quietly led to the slaughter. A brimorak serves as this abattoir's resident executioner. His firey blade makes no distinction between heroes and cowards. Both die swiftly. No flesh shall be spared.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 2

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Begin the scenario with this side up. Blessings played by characters at this location add d4 instead of the normal die. At the end of your turn, flip this card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: This side of this location is always open. Bury a blessing to flip this card.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: This location is never permanently closed.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 2

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Blessings played by characters at this location add d12 instead of the normal die. At the end of your turn, or when this location is not occupied, flip this card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: This side of this location is always temporarily closed.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: This location is never permanently closed.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you would be dealt Combat damage, you are dealt Poison damage instead.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Discard a card that has the Divine trait.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, you are dealt 1 Poison damage.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Just as the Worldwound has polluted Mendev, rivulets of corrupted liquid have seeped into rivers running through its demon-infested wastelands. Poisonous sludge has replaced potable water, killing off all but the hardiest plant life. The strongest survive by learning to use this poisonous terrain to their advantage. As the land is corrupted, so are the monsters and madmen who dwell here. Their weapons are as poisonous as the land in which they live... and the false faith of Worldwound cultists.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 4 Spell 0 Armor 4 Item 0 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you acquire a weapon, you may draw a card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and acquire a random weapon.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Faith and knowledge are powerful weapons, but sometimes, all you really want when you're standing against a horder of demons is a sharpened blade of cold, hard steel. When armies prepare for the latest crusade, they seize any weapons they can find. There's no shortage of implements of destruction in this armory, but heroes who scavenge here might walk away with exotic weapons they've never seen before.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 1 Blessing 3

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you fail a check to defeat a monster, discard a card from the blessings deck.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat the henchman Cultist of Baphomet

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, bury a blessing from your discard pile.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Baphomet's minions and other malefic cultists weaken the resolve of their enemies by defiling sacred shrines. Their acts of depravity and exploitation corrupt temples that once offered sanctuary. Enemies of evil have learned that any resources crusaders redeem are still vulnerable to demonic corruption. Within the Worldwound, the sacred has become profane, the blessed has become blasphemous, and those who seek divinity have become the damned.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 3 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 0 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you encounter a non-henchman, non-villain monster, each other character at this location encounters that monster.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Encounter and acquire the bottom card of the blessings deck.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, shuffle each location deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: On battlefields, the sanctified and the damned maneuver for position. Marching into a canyon might seem like a useful tactic for defenders besieged by demons, but heroes don't always march back out.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn, shuffle each location deck.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 0 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 2 Blessing 4

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you acquire a blessing, examine the top card of any location deck; if it is a non-henchman, non-villain monster, you may banish it.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Wisdom or Divine 7 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, shuffle 1d4+1 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Saint Clydwell sacrificed himself to seal a horde of demons into an inescapable prison. Wounded warriors who have made their own dire sacrifices arrive here each day, seeking healing, sanctuary, and sometimes, timely resurrections for their comrades. Though legions of demons have claimed vast territories in the Worldwound, this sacred ground remains undefiled. Empowered by consecration, the cathedral endures as a refuge against the forces of damnation.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you move or are moved from this location, move to a random other location.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Strength check with a difficulty of 5 plus the scenario's adventure deck number.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, move to a random open location.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Getting lost in a subterranean cavern is all too easy. Even if you've brought a compass or wayfinder, your skill at orienteering aboveground won't always help when you're exploring underground.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn, move to a random location.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 3 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Succeed at a Strength or Disable 7 check to move or be moved.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Bury an ally.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, move to another location and end your turn.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: When crusaders go too far, they sometimes end up inside a prison cell. The stone walls of an oubliette don't know the difference between a heretic and one of Iomedae's faithful followers. Escaping from prison may be somewhat less than heroic, but motivated adventurers may find a way to force an iron bar loose or disable a rusty lock. If that doesn't work, a scoundrel may find a way to lure an unsuspecting victim into this cell. Guards count prisoners each night, but they don't always remember faces.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: All non-villain monsters gain the Undead trait and are immune to the Mental and Poison traits.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Draw a card and bury a card.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Many have died defending these lands from the horrors of the Worldwound. The lucky ones die a hero's death. The unlucky ones die more than once. When holy ground is retaken and corrupted by demonic forces, graves no longer offer comfort to the souls of the dead. When that happens, the restless dead escape from their graves and hunt living victims. Whether those remorseless killers are ghouls, ghosts, or stranger abominations, one purpose unites all undead; their undying hatred of the living.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 0 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 3 Item 0 Ally 3 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: At the end of your turn, you may search your deck for an ally or cohort and add it to your hand.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Combat check with a difficulty of 9 plus twice the scenario's adventure deck number.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, end your turn.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The largest citadel within Kenabres is known as "the Kite," a name inspired by the eighteen-foot-tall kite shield that hangs in its largest hall.The sigil of Kenabres is engraved upon the shield's surface. Nearby, a two-story stone keep protects a wardstone that keeps demons from overrunning the Worldwound's borders. At any given time, at least one crusader and one priest of Iomedae marshal forces inside and outside its walls. Dedicated guards patrol the grounds, eager to prove their valor.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you explore, examine the top 2 cards. Shuffle 1 into the deck, and encounter the other.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Wisdom or Survival check with a difficulty of 7 plus the scenario's adventure deck number.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn, recharge your hand.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The wilderness leads valiant souls astray from the laws and morals of civilization Paths twist into darker realms, and light fades when travelers stray from starlight and narrow ways.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn, recharge your hand.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 2

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When a character dies, all characters at this location die.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat the henchman Wight.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: Before closing, examine the location deck, then set aside those cards. On closing, shuffle those cards into this location deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Generations have fought the good fight against demonic incursions. Young heroes aspire to follow in the footsteps of their ancestors… and all too often, they die the same way their ancestors died.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 2

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you move or are moved here, bury a card. Any character at another location may discard a card to evade an encounter and then move here.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Each character at this location must summon and defeat this adventure's servitor demon.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: This isolated monastery was once a place of refuge for those seeking spiritual enlightenment, but all such aspirations were abandoned long ago. Those who once sought redemption here have lost their way, and they have lost their home. Despite their fall from grace, desperate crusaders still seek this refuge. Demons prey on pilgrims and penitents, but those who survive such predations faintly hope this forsaken cloister can restore their souls, just as crusaders persist in their endless struggle to restore the lands around it.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 2 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you encounter a henchman or villain, before you act, summon and encounter this adventure's servitor demon.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Wisdom or Perception check with a difficulty of 5 plus the scenario's adventure deck number.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the start of your turn, you may recharge 1 card and draw 1 card.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The clanliege of the Grunhuld-Wintersuns once held court here. Now the hall is a cruel parody of its former glory. Barbarians deal death to any who question their right to rule over this estate.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the start of your turn, you may recharge 1 card and draw 1 card.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 0 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 2 Item 0 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: At the start of your turn, summon and encounter the henchman Corrupted Soldier.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat the henchman Corrupted Soldier.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, draw a random armor from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Mongrels crawl through the tunnels of their hidden civilization. Mutants and madmen patrol subterranean kingdoms like the one beneath the city of Kenabres. The gods have forsaken them, so they must remain vigilant in the darkness. Yet for any who can survive the patrols of corrupted soldiers stalking in the surrounding tunnels, a hidden village is ready to accept them. The town that lies beyond this guardpost tenaciously endures like the ideals of a lost generation - dreams upheld by the descendents of crusaders nearly forgotten by history.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 0 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 2 Ally 2 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you would banish an item for its power, bury it instead.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at an Intelligence 7 or Craft 5 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, draw a random item from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Mystical crafters have perfected the art of redeeming artifacts, whether magical or mundane. Unfortunately, if their skills aren't quite up to the task, they may inadvertently destroy the items they're attempting to redeem. Sometimes, they may ruin a few trinkets while gathering the mystical resources required to restore an esoteric or particularly complicated artifact. Of course, any well-stocked laboratory tends to have a few unused magical artifacts lying around the workshop. Crafters pay well for services rendered.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 2 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you encounter a boon of a type other than loot here, draw a random boon of that type from the box; encounter 1 and banish the other.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and acquire a random ally.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Mendev's most elaborate estates have fallen on hard times. Wealthy land owners can no longer count on their safety or security. Instead, travelers come and go across their lands. Vast manor houses are now waystations for pilgrims and wanderers, though some of them are decidedly unfriendly. If you're particularly diplomatic, you might acquire a few boon companions while passing through a neglected estate. If you aren't, of course, you might suddenly attract some new enemies.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 2 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 3 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you attempt to acquire a boon, add 1 plus the scenario's adventure deck number to checks to acquire it.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Choose a type of boon other than loot; summon and acquire a random boon of that type.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn, you may give a card to any character.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Merchants often prosper in times of turmoil, as long as they survive. When adversity is at its worst, heroes and cowards alike desperately purchase any good that will increase their slim chances of survival.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn, you may give a card to any character.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you move, succeed at an Intelligence or Knowledge check with a difficulty of 6 plus twice the scenario's adventure deck number or immediately return to this location.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat the henchman Fiendish Minotaur.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, move each character at this location to a random other location.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: In the realm of a demon, geography can become as twisted as morality. It is said that Baphomet himself dwells at the heart of an Ivory Labyrinth, a byzantine dimension threaded with passageways and corridors that defy attempts to rationalize their sinister designs. Many gods are revered in temples where followers sacrifice their wealth and atone for their sins, but Baphomet does not want such tribute. He rejoices when lesser creatures suffer through the confusion, despair, and loss of hope that plagues anyone who navigates a truly torturous maze.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You cannot play cards or use powers that affect the checks of characters at other locations. When you move, roll 1d4; if you do not discard that many cards from the blessings deck, you cannot move or be moved.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: This location is always closed; it cannot be opened.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: You are now equally distant from every other locale in existence. This dimension defies all concepts of conventional geometry. Getting here is nearly impossible. So is leaving. As soon as you arrive, the residents trapped here aren't terribly judgmental about where you came from, but they are rather motivated to discover where you might be going. Then again, a place like this can wear at your sanity... especially when your latest elaborate attempt to escape leads you right back to where you started.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 3 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When any character at this location would be dealt Combat damage, that character is dealt Fire damage instead. At the start of your turn, you are dealt 1 fire damage.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: You are dealt an amount of Fire damage equal to 1 plus the scenario's adventure deck number.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Magma, rolling lava, searing steam - this pool has a nearly infinite number of ways to incinerate you, and all of them are exquisitely painful. Perhaps demons are the least of your worries.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the start of your turn, you are dealt 1 Fire damage.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 1 Spell 2 Armor 1 Item 4 Ally 0 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: On your check to acquire a boon, you may roll your Divine die instead of the normal die.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Divine 7 check or discard a card that has the Divine trait.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, add 1 of your buried cards to your hand.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: This sanctified locale offers a repite for any who uphold the ideals of the divine. The gods watch over those who prise their names, espeically the ones who revere them in sacred places. Divine spellcasters are rewarded for their years of dedication and prayer when they defend this sacristy. Within its vaulted chambers, priests prepare their prayers, and the wise watch over the vestments and relics used in ceremonies and services. Many have made sacrifices to keep this refuge secure. So must you.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 2 Armor 1 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you move, bury a card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Banish a card that has the Corrupted trait.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, you may bury a card to move.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Lesser sanctums are hidden like occult secrets throughout the Worldwound and the many levels of the Abyss. All of them are but pale imitations of a far more malefic shrine. At the nadir of the Abyss, a floating metal disc inscribed with glowing runes and blasphemous curves hovers above a lake of tar. Upon its surface lies the corrupted Herald of Iomedae, violated when Baphomet ripped his heart from his chest. When you reach that sanctum, will you be the herald's liberators... or sacrificial lambs offered up for slaughter?

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 1 Spell 2 Armor 1 Item 0 Ally 2 Blessing 3

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You may recharge any blessing to add 2 dice to a non-combat Charisma check.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Charisma check with a difficulty of 5 plus twice the scenario's adventure deck number.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, draw a random weapon or item that has the Magic trait from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Iomedae's followers uphold ideals of valor and justice, yet they are more than mere idealists. The inheritor's divine champions are civilization's last hope, and her temples are bastions for the valiant.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: You may recharge any blessing to add 2 dice to a non-combat Charisma check.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 3 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 0 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Combat or Fire damage dealt to you is increased by 1d4.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Each character is dealt 1 Mental damage that may not be reduced.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: All suffering is magnified within this hellhole. Infernal sadists refine their craft over centuries, ensuring torment never ends for their captives. Hedonistic demons pervert both pain and pleasure.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: Combat or Fire damage dealt to you is increased by 1d4.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 2 Item 0 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You may summon and defeat a random monster instead of the normal check to acquire a boon.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Banish a weapon.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, draw a random weapon from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Heroes often go looking for trouble. Standing on the parapets of a watchtower makes searching for it a little easier. Crusaders scan the horizon from their lofty vantage point, looking for signs suggesting that danger, and the rewards that come from defeating it, are nearby. Truly idealistic crusaders don't require material rewards for their fight against evil. The chance to hunt down and destroy the minions of the Worldwound is far more rewarding than any bauble, trinket, gewgaw, or other form of remuneration.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 3 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you encounter a bane, you may not play allies on your checks.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Wisdom or Survival 8 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, bury a boon.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The weak cannot always follow where the virtuous travel. West of Mendev, the Wounded Lands hold the center of Abyssal corruption in this world. Poisonous fumes choke the skies, and a bubbling, primordial coagulation rolls in the realm's dark heart. Don't rely too much on your friends and allies to help you here. They have to breathe the same air that you breathe... at least, as long as they're still breathing.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: On the fringes of the wastelands, life goes on. People live in fear of the horrors of the night, but they still proceed with their daily routines, hoping to see the next day. The hopeful place their faith in the crusaders of Iomedae, heroes who patrol the Worldwound in search of any horrific thing that might prey upon the innocent. But on the road to the Worldwound, you won't find a lot of people who trust that things will go well. Maybe you can change that.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: The Godless Ones The Elven Entanglement The Wardstone Patrol The Traitor's Lodge Vengeance at Sundered Crag

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Each character gains a card feat.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: The servitor demon is the henchman Demonling.

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Adventure Path

property.name: Flavour
property.value: For more than a hundred years, the demon-infested Worldwound has warred against humanity. Along the border of lost Sarkoris, Abyssal armies clash with crusaders, barbarians, and mercenaries, yet the city of Kenabres stands defiant. Demon lords conspire to bring down the last vestiges of resistance, sacrificing legions of servitors. Queen Galfrey has sent out the call: can heroes seal the Worldwound forever?

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Adventure Path

property.name: Attr1
property.value: The Worldwound Incursion Sword of Valor Demon's Heresy The Midnight Isles Herald of the Ivory Labyrinth City of Locusts

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Each character gains a card feat.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: In locations that have the Abyssal trait, ignore the Outsider trait on banes. After you begin Demon's Heresy, when you would banish a bane that has the Basic trait, remove it form the game; when you would banish a boon that has the Basic trait, you may remove it from the game. After you begin Herald of the Ivory Labyrinth, do the same for cards that have the Elite trait.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The road to the Worldwound has pockets of deep forest laden with entanglements. "Uprooter" elves use the twisted forest to their advantage. An eager toad demon has greater ambitions, so the elves and satyrs must seek aid from outlanders.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Dark Forest Watchtower Wounded Lands Cemetery Abyssal River Guardpost Cavern Molten Pool

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Cohort: Cecilla the Uprooter

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Instead of the first exploration of your turn, you may summon and encounter the henchman Fiendish Tree; if you defeat it, draw the cohort Vinst from the box. If you would encounter a card that has the Animal trait, summon and encounter the henchman Carnivorous Stump instead.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Vescavor Swarm Tangle Traps

property.name: Attr4
property.value: Each character draws a random weapon or spell from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The Worldwound's demons would not be so conficent about their chances of success without allies hidden among the people they prey upon. The demonoligist Sophini and several of her Blackfire Adept minions want to bend demons to their will. Show them whose will is strongest.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Forsaken Cloister Manor House Marketplace Armory Watchtower Laboratory Citadel Sanctum

property.name: Attr1
property.value: When you acquire an ally, you may succeed at an Intelligence or Knowledge 6 check to examine the top card of any location deck.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Blackfire Adept Ceustodaemon Cultist of Baphomets

property.name: Attr4
property.value: Each character draws a random blessing that has the Corrupted trait from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The dark summoner Thurl abandoned his macabre laboratories to ghosts and spectral guardians. Among these warders was the ghostly minotaur Karsos, a onetime servitor of Baphomet. Now Karsos haunts the grisly halls, awaiting foolhardy adventurers with the patience of the dead.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Cemetery Laboratory Manor House Torture Chamber Cell Great Hall Sacristy Abattoir

property.name: Attr1
property.value: When you defeat a non-villain bane that has the Undead trait on your turn, choose weapon, spell, armor, or item; display a random card of that type from the box. You may shuffle that bane into a random open location to put that boon under this card; otherwise, banish that bane and the chosen card. When the first location is closed, the character that closed it draws the loot Sacred Prism from the box.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Ghalcor Unfettered Eidolon Wights

property.name: Attr4
property.value: Gain all the cards under this card, or gain no reward and you may immediately attempt this scenario again.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Crusaders of Iomedae patrol the Worldwound, guarding the magic wardstones that hold Abyssal horders at bay. As the wardstones begin to crumble, valiant defenders such as the brave Sir Ilivan are the last line of defense. Will they be enough to turn back the demonic hordes?

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Befouled Altar Family Tomb Guardpost Wounded Lands Cavern Armory Cathedral of St. Clydwell Canyon

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Cohort: Sir Ilivan

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If you fail a check to defeat a bane, you may recharge a card that has the Soldier or Hireling trait to reroll the dice; take the new result. When you play the cohort Sir Ilivan on a check to defeat a monster, examine the top card of the blessings deck. If it has the Corrupted trait, banish Sir Ilivan and summon and encounter the henchman Corrupted Soldier.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: Each character gains a random ally that has the Hireling or Soldier trait from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Thurl experimented upon malformed eidolons. Now his victims wreak havoc, exacting their rage against summoners in depraved rampages. While citizens cower, the conjurer Tancred Desimire is raising a demon army. His goal is simple destroy the Pathrinder Society forever.
